title: Strictly Come Dancing 2019: Bruno Tonioli replaced by Alfonso Ribeiro
text:
Bruno will be MIA (Picture: PA)

Bruno Tonioli will miss next week’s Strictly Come Dancing due to work commitments in America.

The Italian judge will be replaced by Fresh Prince of Bel Air star Alfonso Ribeiro.

Bruno, 63, will miss out on the live show on 19 October due to prior work commitments in America on Dancing With The Stars.

The star is also a judge on the US version of Strictly alongside Len Goodman, and usually flies to the States during the week and returns for Saturday’s show.

However, this isn’t the first time Bruno has missed Strictly in favour of Dancing With The Stars.

Bruno has prior commitments in the States (Picture: ABC via Getty Images)

In 2017, the judging panel was reduced to three judges when Bruno had to jet to the States, while last year, Carlton himself, Alfonso, took Bruno’s seat.

The 48-year-old won Dancing With The Stars in 2014 and created the iconic Carlton dance – so he knows a thing or two about fancy footwork.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Ribeiro was a hit last year when he stood in for Bruno, so we’re expecting the same reaction again – as much as we’ll miss the Italian stallion getting over-excited about Kelvin Fletcher’s hips.

A rep for the show confirmed: ‘Thirteen celebrity couples remain in the race to be crowned Strictly Come Dancing champion 2019.

‘Each of them will take to the floor in a bid to impress the awesome foursome judges Craig Revel Horwood, Shirley Ballas, Motsi Mabuse and returning guest judge Alfonso Ribeiro, in the studio, as well as viewers at home.’

This weekend’s Strictly will go ahead as usual, with Catherine Tyldesley taking on a Charleston, Mike Bushell quickstepping to Come On Eileen, and Saffron Barker attempting contemporary dance in the second Couple’s Choice of the series.
